overview: In this subject, students will apply their reflective and practice-led research skills in a project relevant to their own performing practice. Students will be supported in carrying out their previously-proposed research project, and presenting their work in both oral and written form. The project is intended to suit, but is not limited to, students who have undertaken the subject Opera Performance Practicum 4.
ilo: critically engage with relevant scholarly literature;
conduct research in an ethical manner;
reflect critically on the research process;
constructively engage with and respond to the work of student peers.

Prerequisites.content: This subject cannot be taken concurrently.

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Further details on how to seek academic adjustments can be found on the Student Equity and Disability Support website:http://services.unimelb.edu.au/student-equity/home

assessment.brief:
Oral project presentation.

Submitted online in podcast format, 15 minutes (equivalent to 2000 words)

Constructive contributions to discussion board & peers' presentations (500-words)

Due: Discussion board closes 2 weeks after the end of semester
